title: 5 euro note
summary: The five euro note (€5) is the lowest value euro banknote and has been used since the introduction of the euro (in its cash form) in 2002.[9] The note is used in the 25 countries which have it as their sole currency (with 23 legally adopting it); with a total population of about 343 million currently.[10] In May 2021, there were approximately 1,977,000,000 five euro banknotes in circulation around the eurozone. It is the fifth most widely circulated denomination, accounting for 7.3% of the total banknotes.[11] Estimates suggest that the average life of a five euro banknote is less than a year before it is replaced due to wear.[12]
